page.title: 02The Peregrine Falcons
page.content: ************************************** The Peregrine falcons are a protected species.We are very lucky to have them nesting in our Domesday Block at Symonds Yat rock grid reference{56/13. Symonds Yat is a{S.S.S.I.}({Sight of {Special Scientific Interest}) In the Summer of{1984}roughly{45,000} people came to see them in this area of outstanding natural beauty.The{RSPB have taken interest in the birds.They have a warden to watch the falcons. They have laid three eggs. Two eggs were hatched, but subsequently died in the cold weather of early spring 1985.The third egg is infertile and will never hatch despite the fact that the parent birds are still trying to incubate it.
